column4: Hi i'm trying to configer ip adress settings and when i press configer in network tools  it say's " the interface does not exist" anyone know what that means and what i can to do fix it ?

Hi i'm trying to configer ip adress settings and when i press configer in network tools  it say's " the interface does not exist" anyone know what that means and what i can to do fix it ?  Please can anyone help me ?
apparently your hardware isn't detected
this could mean that either there's no kernel support for it or that you don't have the appropriate driver(s) loaded for it
but it works my internet is working fine i just wanna change my ip on the network and cant do that ??
should i find drivers if so how do i do that ?
post the output of dmesg to pastebin. also post the output of lsmod.
if you can, try posting on pastebin the output of lshw as well
sorry i didint relly understand what you said ??? whats pastebin  and all that ??
ok what should i put there ?
read my previous message again. if you're not going to put any effort in to helping yourself, i'm not going to try either
dmesg ?? and lsmod  ??? yeahh i am just dont know what these two are sorry
they are commands. open a terminal emulator (konsole, gnome-terminal, xterm, etc.) or from the console, run those commands and paste the output to pastebin
ok i run dmesg and lsmod in the termenal and then post em there RGR
should i copy all the text becuz its like 5 pages long ?
yes, everything. enter the commands man dmesg and man lsmod for why i asked for those
its written in the kmsg file right ??  and when i try to open it it says i dont have the rights to see it ??
